name: richardc-datacat
author: richardc
summary: Puppet type for handling data fragments
description: A pair of types for handling data fragments and templating

types.name: datacat_collector
types.doc:
Manages the merging of data and updating a related resource parameter.

The `datacat_collector` type deeply merges a data hash from
the `datacat_fragment` resources that target it.

These fragments are then rendered via an erb template specified by the
`template_body` parameter and used to update the `target_field` property
of the related `target_resource`.

Sample usage:

  datacat_collector { 'open_ports':
    template_body => '<%= @data["ports"].sort.join(",") %>',
    target_resource => File_line['open_ports'],
    target_field    => 'line',
  }

  datacat_fragment { 'open webserver':
    target => 'open_ports',
    data   => { ports => [ 80, 443 ] },
  }

  datacat_fragment { 'open ssh':
    target => 'open_ports',
    data   => { ports => [ 22 ] },
  }


For convenience the common use case of targeting a file is wrapped in the
datacat defined type.

properties.name: ensure
properties.doc:
The basic property that the resource should be in.

Valid values are `present`, `absent`.

parameters.name: path
parameters.doc: An identifier (typically a file path) that can be used by datacat_fragments so they know where to target the data.

parameters.name: collects
parameters.doc: Other resources we want to collect data from.  Allows for many-many datacats.

parameters.name: target_resource
parameters.doc: The resource that we're going to set the field (eg File['/tmp/demo']) set theto set data tor

parameters.name: target_field
parameters.doc: The field of the resource to put the results in

parameters.name: source_key
parameters.doc: If specified, the key from @data to copy across to the target_field (bypasses template evaluation)

parameters.name: template
parameters.doc: Path to the template to render.  Used in error reporting.

parameters.name: template_body
parameters.doc: The slurped body of the template to render.

types.name: datacat_fragment
types.doc: A fragment of data for a datacat resource.

parameters.name: target
parameters.doc: The title of the datacat resource that the data should be considered part of.  May be an array to indicate multiple targetted collectors.

parameters.name: order
parameters.doc: The order in which to merge this fragment into the datacat resource.  Defaults to the string "50"

parameters.name: data
parameters.doc: A hash of data to be merged for this resource.
